policyDetailsPage.point1:
1.Data protection at a glance
General notes
The following notes provide a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when our application uses digitact.According to Art.4(1)DSGVO, personal data are all data with which you can be personally identified.Detailed information on the topic of data protection can be found in our data protection declaration listed under this text.
The operators of this application take the protection of your personal data very seriously.We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this data protection declaration.
 
Data collection in our application
Who is responsible for data acquisition in the application?
Data processing of the application by

Consileon Business Consultancy GmbH,
Maximilianstr.5,
76133 Karlsruhe,Germany.
 
How do we collect your data?
One way we collect your data is by letting us know what you have entered into the application.
No other data is collected.
 
What do we use your data for?
The data is collected for your contact and application process.
 
What rights do you have regarding your data?
In accordance with Chapter III of the DSGVO,you have the right to receive information free of charge at any time about the origin,recipient and purpose of your stored personal data.You also have the right to demand the correction,blocking or deletion of this data.You can contact us at any time at the address given in the imprint for this purpose and for further questions on the subject of data protection.Furthermore,you have a right of appeal to the responsible supervisory authority.
policyDetailsPage.point2:
2. General information and compulsory information
2.1 Note on the responsible body and data protection officer
The person responsible for data processing in this application is

Consileon Business Consultancy GmbH
Maximilianstr. 5
76133 Karlsruhe
Represented by Dr. Joachim Schü

Phone: +49 721 35460-80
fax: +49 721 35460-89
e-mail: info[at]consileon.de

Responsible party is the natural or legal person who, alone or jointly with others, decides on the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g. names, e-mail addresses or similar).
You can contact the data protection officer of the entity in charge at [at]consileon.de
natalie.dittrich[at]consileon.de
or in writing to the address of the data controller with the appropriate reference "z.H.Datenschutzbeauftragte
policyDetailsPage.point3:
3. Rights of data subjects
3.1 Revocation of your consent to data processing
Many data processing operations are only possible with your express consent. You can revoke any consent already given at any time. For this purpose, an informal notification by e-mail to us is sufficient. The legality of the data processing carried out up to the time of revocation remains unaffected by the revocation.
3.2 Right of appeal to the competent supervisory authority
In the event of violations of data protection law, the person concerned has a right of appeal to the competent supervisory authority.
For Consileon Business Consultancy GmbH, Maximilianstraße 5, 76133 Karlsruhe, Germany, the state data protection commissioner of Baden-Württemberg is the competent supervisory authority in data protection matters. The commissioner can be reached athttps://www.baden-wuerttemberg.datenschutz.de/.
For Consileon Frankfurt GmbH, Neue Mainzer Straße 74, 60311 Frankfurt am Main, Germany, the supervisory authority in charge of data protection is the data protection commissioner of the state of Hesse. He can be contacted athttps://datenschutz.hessen.de/.
3.3 Right to data transferability
You have the right to have data, which we process automatically on the basis of your consent or in fulfilment of a contract, handed over to you or to a third party in a common, machine-readable format. If you request the direct transfer of the data to another responsible party, this will only take place to the extent that it is technically feasible.
3.4 Information, blocking, deletion
Within the framework of the applicable legal provisions of Chapter III DSGVO, you have the right to obtain information free of charge at any time about your stored personal data, its origin and recipients and the purpose of the data processing and, if applicable, the right to correct, block or delete this data without delay. For this purpose, as well as for any further questions on the subject of personal data, you may contact us at any time at the contact information provided in the data protection declaration, at the address given in the imprint or by e-mail to datenschutz[at]consileon.de.
policyDetailsPage.point4:
4. Right of objection
If your personal data are processed on the basis of legitimate interests pursuant to Art. 6, Paragraph 1, Sentence 1, Letter f) DPA, you have the right to object to the processing of your personal data pursuant to Art. 21 DPA, if there are reasons for doing so that arise from your particular situation or if the objection is directed against direct advertising. In the latter case, you have a general right of objection, which will be implemented by us without specifying a special situation.
If you wish to exercise your right of objection or revocation, simply send an e-mail to data protection[at]consileon.de.
